summary: This is a proposed joint jury instruction document from the criminal trial of Ghislaine Maxwell in the Southern District of New York. It outlines detailed legal instructions for the jury regarding the six counts against Maxwell, including conspiracy, enticement, transportation, and sex trafficking of minors, covering the period from 1994 to 2004. The document provides legal definitions, elements of each crime, and general jury procedures.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The sole defendant in the criminal case, charged with six counts related to enticing and transporting minors for illegal sexual activity and sex trafficking.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: United States District Judge whose prior jury charge instructions are frequently cited and adapted throughout this document.

persons.name: Denise L. Cote
persons.context: United States District Judge whose prior jury charge instructions are cited and adapted in this document.

persons.name: Kimba M. Wood
persons.context: United States District Judge whose prior jury charge instructions, particularly regarding sex trafficking, are cited and adapted in this document.

persons.name: Damian Williams
persons.context: The United States Attorney who submitted this proposed jury instruction document on behalf of the government.

persons.context: United States District Judge whose prior jury charge instructions are cited in the document.

persons.context: United States District Judge (referenced as 'Hon. L.G.S.' likely meaning Loretta G. Schofield, but the document shows 'Hon. Loran G. Schofield' which appears to be a typographical variation; standard reference is to Judge Loretta A. Preska).

persons.name: Richard J. Sullivan
persons.context: United States District Judge whose prior jury charge instructions are cited in the document.

connections.description: The indictment charges Maxwell with conspiring with others to commit the offenses. The jury instructions discuss liability for acts of co-conspirators.

events.title: Alleged Conspiracy Period
events.description: The time period during which Ghislaine Maxwell is alleged to have conspired with others to entice and transport minors for illegal sexual activity.

events.title: Alleged Offenses Involving Minor Victim-1
events.description: The time period for Counts Two and Four, which relate to the enticement and transportation of 'Minor Victim-1' for illegal sexual activity.

events.title: Alleged Sex Trafficking of Minor Victim-4
events.description: The time period for Counts Five and Six, which relate to conspiracy to engage in and the actual sex trafficking of 'Minor Victim-4'.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was charged with six counts: conspiracy to entice minors (Count One), enticement of a minor (Count Two), conspiracy to transport minors (Count Three), transportation of a minor (Count Four), conspiracy to engage in sex trafficking (Count Five), and sex trafficking of a minor (Count Six).
The alleged criminal activity spanned from approximately 1994 to 2004, involving multiple minor victims identified as Minor Victim-1 (1994-1997) and Minor Victim-4 (2001-2004).
The charges include both substantive crimes and conspiracy charges, with Maxwell also potentially liable under an aiding and abetting theory for the substantive counts.
The document is a proposed joint jury instruction, indicating it was prepared for the judge's consideration to guide the jury in the legal standards applicable to the case.
The instructions detail complex legal concepts such as conscious avoidance, the distinction between direct and circumstantial evidence, and the requirements for proving conspiracy.
